snippet: The automaker will spend $640 million to replace latches to prevent doors from unexpectedly popping open in some 2.4 million vehicles....
abstract: Ford announces that 1.5 million vehicles will be added to growing door-latch recall, after National Highway Traffic Safety Admin deems carmaker's August figure of 830,000 vehicles inadequate; at least three million vehicles have been recalled, and manufacturer estimates it will spend $640 million to replace defective latches.
lead_paragraph: The automaker will spend $640 million to replace latches to prevent doors from unexpectedly popping open in some 2.4 million vehicles.

headline.main: Ford Expands Costly Door Latch Recall
headline.print_headline: Ford Expands a Costly Recall of Door Latches
